column4: Explain why you have chosen to concentrate in this academic area.
Think of a challenge you have dealt with.  Did you fail or succeed?  How did you manage the challenge?
Describe an ethical dilemma you have dealt with.  Did you fail or succeed?  How did you manage the challenge?
Think of a time when you failed but did not recover from the failure.  What happened?  How did you overcome the failure?  What did you learn from this failure?
When was a time that you were forced to take a risk?
Describe a time you confronted an enemy.  How did you deal with it?  What was the outcome?
What is intellectually challenging to you?
What do you believe in?
What do you believe to be true about the world around you?
What is one of the most important values to you? Why?
Comment on how you deal with a diversity of beliefs.
Explain a time you dealt with an ethical dilemma that caused a conflict with your belief.
Describe a belief you are passionate about.  Do you try to convince others to be equally passionate?  How do you deal when they aren't as passionate as you are?
Describe a time when you changed one of your beliefs.  How did you deal with it?  What was the result?
What does community mean to you?
Describe your background and how it has affected you.
What communities do you belong to? Why are they important to you?
What does it mean to contribute to your community?  How do you contribute?  How do others see your contribution?
How do you describe diversity in your community?
What current issues are facing your different communities?
How do you see the world? What do you see as your role in the world?
What does it mean to contribute to the world?  How do you contribute?  How do others see your contribution?
How does the world deal with diversity?  Is this good/bad?  How do you deal with globaly diversity?  What is working?  What isn't?
How do you see the global world around you?  How does it affect you? What is your affect on it?
What current issues are facing the world?  Which ones are serious?  Which aren't?
What are your goals?  Long term?  Short term?  Career?  Personal?  Random?
What is your vision for the world?  What is your vision for your adult self?
What kind of work is exciting for a career?
What do you believe about the future?  What is important?  Not important?
What does education mean to you?
What are your academic interests? What are you passionate about with education?
What are you intellectually curious about? How does it affect the way you educate yourself?  In school?  Outside of school?
What do you think about school?  Good?  Bad?  Why?
What do you do beyond school and traditional learning?
What is a current issue facing education locally?  Globally?
Is technology education important?  What effect does technology have on education?  Is this good or bad?
Why do you want to study this subject?
Why do you find this academic area of study interesting?
When did you first hear about this subject?
Where do you get your inspiration to continuing studying this subject from?
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
Why do you want this? Do tell! This prompt awaits final text.
What event in your life has been most meaningful?  What is important to you when you look back at your high school experience?  Why?
Describe your accomplishments.  What honors or awards have you achieved? What have you accomplished outside of school?
Have you been a leader?  Have you seen a good leader/bad leader?  How did you react? How do you feel about leadership?  Is it important?
What do you do outside of school?
Do you have an internship or work experience? Describe it and explain why it was meaningful to you.
Have you done any research?  Formally?  Informally?
What did you do over the summer?  Why did you try to do this?
Think of your autobiography - which parts of your life would be most compelling for an outside reader?
Express one aspect of your personality. What makes you unique?
What are you passionate about?
What does being creative mean to you?  How are you creative?  Is creativity important?
Would you make a good roommate?  Why or why not?
What's your favorite place?
What do you do for fun?
